did.abstract: This collection contains the papers of Brooklyn writer and poet Maude White Hardie, including autobiographical writings, poems, essays, correspondence and family letters, diaries, books, postcards, brochures, and legal and financial documents.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Maude White Hardie was a writer and poet who lived with her husband, Charles Hardie, on East 19th Street in Brooklyn, N.Y. Charles Hardie was a chemist who worked for a German Aniline Company that later became the well-known I.G. Farben Industry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the papers of Brooklyn writer and poet Maude White Hardie, including autobiographical writings, poems, essays, correspondence and family letters, diaries, books, postcards, brochures, and legal and financial documents.
